sqlparse.sql

This module contains classes representing syntactical elements of SQL.

Classes

NameAliasMixin

Implements get_real_name and get_alias.

Token

Base class for all other classes in this module.

TokenList

A group of tokens.

Statement

Represents a SQL statement.

Identifier

Represents an identifier.

IdentifierList

A list of Identifier's.

TypedLiteral

A typed literal, such as "date '2001-09-28'" or "interval '2 hours'".

Parenthesis

Tokens between parenthesis.

SquareBrackets

Tokens between square brackets

Assignment

An assignment like 'var := val;'

If

An 'if' clause with possible 'else if' or 'else' parts.

For

A 'FOR' loop.

Comparison

A comparison used for example in WHERE clauses.

Comment

A comment.

Where

A WHERE clause.

Over

An OVER clause.

Having

A HAVING clause.

Case

A CASE statement with one or more WHEN and possibly an ELSE part.

Function

A function or procedure call.

Begin

A BEGIN/END block.

Operation

Grouping of operations

Values

Grouping of values

Command

Grouping of CLI commands.

Implements get_real_name and get_alias.

Returns the real name (object name) of this identifier.

get_alias()[source]

Returns the alias for this identifier or None.

class sqlparse.sql.Token(ttype, value)[source]

Base class for all other classes in this module.

It represents a single token and has two instance attributes: value is the unchanged value of the token and ttype is the type of the token.

value = ''[source]
ttype[source]
parent = None[source]
is_group = False[source]
is_keyword[source]
is_whitespace[source]
is_newline[source]
normalized = ''[source]
flatten()[source]

Resolve subgroups.

match(ttype, values, regex=False)[source]

Checks whether the token matches the given arguments.

ttype is a token type. If this token doesn’t match the given token type. values is a list of possible values for this token. The values are OR’ed together so if only one of the values matches True is returned. Except for keyword tokens the comparison is case-sensitive. For convenience it’s OK to pass in a single string. If regex is True (default is False) the given values are treated as regular expressions.

within(group_cls)[source]

Returns True if this token is within group_cls.

Use this method for example to check if an identifier is within a function: t.within(sql.Function).

is_child_of(other)[source]

Returns True if this token is a direct child of other.

has_ancestor(other)[source]

Returns True if other is in this tokens ancestry.

class sqlparse.sql.TokenList(tokens=None)[source]

Bases: Token

A group of tokens.

It has an additional instance attribute tokens which holds a list of child-tokens.

tokens = [][source]
is_group = True[source]
get_token_at_offset(offset)[source]

Returns the token that is on position offset.

flatten()[source]

Generator yielding ungrouped tokens.

This method is recursively called for all child tokens.

get_sublists()[source]
token_first(skip_ws=True, skip_cm=False)[source]

Returns the first child token.

If skip_ws is True (the default), whitespace tokens are ignored.

if skip_cm is True (default: False), comments are ignored too.

token_next_by(i=None, m=None, t=None, idx=-1, end=None)[source]
token_not_matching(funcs, idx)[source]
token_matching(funcs, idx)[source]
token_prev(idx, skip_ws=True, skip_cm=False)[source]

Returns the previous token relative to idx.

If skip_ws is True (the default) whitespace tokens are ignored. If skip_cm is True comments are ignored. None is returned if there’s no previous token.

token_next(idx, skip_ws=True, skip_cm=False, _reverse=False)[source]

Returns the next token relative to idx.

If skip_ws is True (the default) whitespace tokens are ignored. If skip_cm is True comments are ignored. None is returned if there’s no next token.

token_index(token, start=0)[source]

Return list index of token.

group_tokens(grp_cls, start, end, include_end=True, extend=False)[source]

Replace tokens by an instance of grp_cls.

insert_before(where, token)[source]

Inserts token before where.

insert_after(where, token, skip_ws=True)[source]

Inserts token after where.

has_alias()[source]

Returns True if an alias is present.

get_alias()[source]

Returns the alias for this identifier or None.

get_name()[source]

Returns the name of this identifier.

This is either it’s alias or it’s real name. The returned valued can be considered as the name under which the object corresponding to this identifier is known within the current statement.

get_real_name()[source]

Returns the real name (object name) of this identifier.

get_parent_name()[source]

Return name of the parent object if any.

A parent object is identified by the first occurring dot.

class sqlparse.sql.Statement(tokens=None)[source]

Bases: TokenList

Represents a SQL statement.

get_type()[source]

Returns the type of a statement.

The returned value is a string holding an upper-cased reprint of the first DML or DDL keyword. If the first token in this group isn’t a DML or DDL keyword “UNKNOWN” is returned.

Whitespaces and comments at the beginning of the statement are ignored.

class sqlparse.sql.Identifier(tokens=None)[source]

Bases: NameAliasMixin, TokenList

Represents an identifier.

Identifiers may have aliases or typecasts.

is_wildcard()[source]

Return True if this identifier contains a wildcard.

get_typecast()[source]

Returns the typecast or None of this object as a string.

get_ordering()[source]

Returns the ordering or None as uppercase string.

get_array_indices()[source]

Returns an iterator of index token lists

class sqlparse.sql.IdentifierList(tokens=None)[source]

Bases: TokenList

A list of Identifier’s.

get_identifiers()[source]

Returns the identifiers.

Whitespaces and punctuations are not included in this generator.
